Zombie, Plague

This walking corpse wears only a few soiled rags, its flesh rotting off its bones as it stumbles forward, arms outstretched.



Plague Zombie

CR 1/2

XP 200
NE Medium undead
Init +0; Senses darkvision 60 ft.; Perception +0
DEFENSE
AC 12, touch 10, flat-footed 12 (+2 natural)
hp 12 (2d8+3)
Fort +0, Ref +0, Will +3
Immune undead traits
OFFENSE
Spd 30 ft.
Melee slam +4 (1d6+4 plus disease)
Space 5 ft.; Reach 5 ft.
Special Attacks death burst
STATISTICS
Str 17, Dex 10, Con -, Int -, Wis 10, Cha 10
Base Atk +1; CMB +4; CMD 14
Feats ToughnessB
SQ staggered
ECOLOGY
Environment any
Organization any
Treasure none
SPECIAL ABILITIES
Death Burst (Ex) When a plague zombie dies, it explodes in a burst of decay. All creatures adjacent to the plague zombie are exposed to its plague as if struck by a slam attack and must make a Fortitude save or contract zombie rot.
Disease (Su) The slam attack - as well as any other natural attacks - of a plague zombie carries the zombie rot disease. Zombie rot: slam; save Fort DC 11; onset 1d4 days; frequency 1/day; effect 1d2 Con, this damage cannot be healed while the creature is infected; cure 2 consecutive saves. Anyone who dies while infected rises as a plague zombie in 2d6 hours.
Staggered (Ex) Zombies have poor reflexes and can only perform a single move action or standard action each round. A zombie can move up to its speed and attack in the same round as a charge action.


These zombies carry a terrible disease that perpetuates their undead lineage-those infected by a plague zombie's contagion rise as zombies themselves when they perish.
